intro: Anthyllis vulneraria subsp. busambarensis, commonly known as the mountain everlasting, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers and hairy, upright stems. This subspecies is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant has adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in mountainous regions. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and dispersed by wind, contributing to its ecological role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
